page.title: 10Farming Part 2
page.content: The{Bairds}livestock varies quite considerably. There are two crosses of cattle.{Charolais}and{Friesians, {Highlanders}and{Simmental.}There is one{Dexter}cow. Most of the ewes have lambed. They are a cross between{North {Country Cheviots}and a{Suffolk}ram. The ewes have produced seventy-five lambs which will be fattened and sold in the local market. Another breed of sheep is the{Wensleydales.}They have only been at the farm for about a year. The{Bairds}have four pet goats whose milk they use. The poultry, about sixty, lay enough eggs to sell locally. They also sell duck eggs. They keep{bantams, guinea fowl}and one {Canada goose.}The{Bairds}have an {incubator,}a heated box for hatching eggs, that they use to maintain their stocks of poultry. It can incubate 36 eggs at a time.
